tool.name: Concatenate multiple datasets
tool.command: cat #for $f in $f1# #if $f.is_collection# #for $inner in {$f.forward}# $inner #end for# #else# $f # #end if# #end for# >> "$out_file1"
tool.help:
.. class:: warningmark
**WARNING:** Be careful not to concatenate datasets of different kinds (e.g., sequences with intervals). This tool does not check if the datasets being concatenated are in the same format.
-----
**What it does**
Concatenates forward reads in FASTQ format from data collection
-----
**Example**
Concatenating Dataset::
@M03033:102:000000000-ATN0P:1:1110:9065:13771_Sample13/1 TTAGATACCCGGGTAGTCCACGCAGTAAACGATGAATGCTAATTGTCCGGAGGGAT + EGFFGFEGFFEGGGGFEEF9E:CFFGFEGDEFFEGFFGFEGFFEGGGGFEEF9E:C
with Dataset1::
@M03033:102:000000000-ATN0P:1:2102:17440:16321_Sample18/1 TTAGATACCCTGGTAGTCCACGCCGTAAACGATGACTACTAGGTGTCGGGTGGCAA + FGEFGGGEEGGGGGFFFAFCF@CFCFF9FFGGFCE59CFGEECCE@FGEFGGGEEG
and with Dataset2::
@M03033:102:000000000-ATN0P:1:2102:17440:20111_Sample120/1 TTCCTTCGGGACAGGGGAGTCAGGTGGTGCATGGTTGTCGTCAGCTCGTGTCGTGG + FFGGFGFGGE9EDFGGGGGGGGGEGGECFGEFCCGGFGGGFGGFFGGFGFGGE9ED
will result in the following::
@M03033:102:000000000-ATN0P:1:1110:9065:13771_Sample13/1 TTAGATACCCGGGTAGTCCACGCAGTAAACGATGAATGCTAATTGTCCGGAGGGAT + EGFFGFEGFFEGGGGFEEF9E:CFFGFEGDEFFEGFFGFEGFFEGGGGFEEF9E:C @M03033:102:000000000-ATN0P:1:2102:17440:16321_Sample18/1 TTAGATACCCTGGTAGTCCACGCCGTAAACGATGACTACTAGGTGTCGGGTGGCAA + FGEFGGGEEGGGGGFFFAFCF@CFCFF9FFGGFCE59CFGEECCE@FGEFGGGEEG @M03033:102:000000000-ATN0P:1:2102:17440:20111_Sample120/1 TTCCTTCGGGACAGGGGAGTCAGGTGGTGCATGGTTGTCGTCAGCTCGTGTCGTGG + FFGGFGFGGE9EDFGGGGGGGGGEGGECFGEFCCGGFGGGFGGFFGGFGFGGE9ED
-----
Adapted from galaxy's catWrapper.xml to allow multiple input files
